title: PSA: ATTACK THE NEXUS
body:
Just lost a completely winnable game bc my team didnt attack the nexus and i was the only one. Let me tell you a brief story:

After a long game of neither team ever really having an advantage, our team won a teamfight and left 4 people dead in exchange for only 1 on our side. I, the adc mf, was taking down turrets with my team while the enemy tank shyvana was distracting us. We get to the nexus, aaand im the only one attacking it, while the other 3 members of my team are trying to kill the tank shyvana. 

10 seconds later, ive gotten the nexus to like 40% hp while all of my teammates are STILL trying to chase the tank shyvana down, when all of the enemies respawn and charge us down, killing us all and then ending the game (we lost.)

So please, ladies and gentlemen. Dont put yourself in my story, losing a game for no reason, and attack the nexus. It is the only thing you have to do to win the game.

I'm impressed an ADC wasn't able to take down a nexus in ten seconds.

I played a game where the other team was way ahead of us, but we had a few lucky teamfights and thus were at their nexus (Also their Leona went AFK)

So the other team didn't have any real DPS but they try to baron with like a inhib and nexus up in midlane. 

My team chooses to go for the baron fight instead of the Inhib when I was basically screaming to group and then end. 

Their ego got in front of the facts. Yes we got lucky shit earlier, but we are 5-8k gold behind. They CANNOT kill baron fast, they don't have a DPS, THUS we can end in time or at the very least force them off baron. 

But no, they ran into baron, died then we eventually lost the game as the Leona came back & they abused their gold lead.
This type of thing happens to me all the time. Let's pad the KDA instead of winning the game.

I don't know whats more tilting, losing because your team chased instead of killing the Nexus; or losing because your team was spamming mastery and running around instead of killing the Nexus. However rare, I've seen both happen, lol.
